author: Brian Zalewski <brian@megabyte.space> (https://megabyte.space)

blueprint.description: An automated Ubuntu Desktop (currently, version MAJOR_VERSION.MINOR_VERSION) Packer project that builds boxes using the latest Ubuntu Live Server release
blueprint.description_template_package: An automated Ubuntu Desktop (currently, version MAJOR_VERSION.MINOR_VERSION) Packer project that builds boxes using the latest Ubuntu Live Server release
blueprint.name: Ubuntu Desktop
blueprint.overview: This project houses configurations that can be used to build performant Ubuntu Desktop images. It uses the Ubuntu Desktop Live image as a base, uses Packer to automate the build process, and then sets the image up using some [Bento scripts](https://github.com/chef/bento/tree/main/packer_templates/ubuntu/scripts) which take care of optimizing the image for your system (i.e. setting up SSH with the Vagrant default public key, setting up GuestAdditions for VirtualBox, etc.). This project is intended to be used to create desktop images that you would launch from your main desktop using a GUI. If you are looking for headless images, you should either use [Bento's server images](https://app.vagrantup.com/bento). You might also have some luck browsing through our [Packer projects](https://gitlab.com/megabyte-labs/packer).
blueprint.title: Ubuntu Desktop Template for Packer
blueprint.version_description: Ubuntu Desktop ISO_VERSION. Built from the Ubuntu Live Desktop ISO_VERSION image. See https://gitlab.com/megabyte-labs/packer/ubuntu-desktop for more details.

description: An automated Ubuntu Desktop (currently, version MAJOR_VERSION.MINOR_VERSION) Packer project that builds boxes using the latest Ubuntu Live Server release
name: @mblabs/ubuntu-desktop

descriptions.build: Builds the project using the build command specified under scripts in package.json
descriptions.help: Display the Bodega Taskfile.yml interactive help menu
descriptions.prepare: A hook triggered by running npm install that runs logic such as installing pre-commit hooks
descriptions.repair: Fixes basic issues in projects that are having trouble running basic commands like 'task start'
descriptions.start: Entrypoint for new developers that installs requirements and then runs 'task start'
descriptions.test: Runs the appropriate test logic by running the test command defined under scripts in package.json

scripts.prepare: npm run start && (test -f Taskfile.yml && task common:husky) || true
